commit message: Changes by Android Studio.
Update gradle version

Move drawable-svg-originals out of res/

Because the latest gradle seems to fail if they are in /res.
Changes by Android Studio.
Tests: Use the latest mockwebserver version.
Use latest Gradle version

Add @Nullable annotations.

Using the Android annotations suppport library.
Fix an indent.
Use some @NonNull parameter annotations.
Avoid unnecessary fully qualified names.
Remove some outdated comments.
tiny whitespace fix.

ClassifyActivity.startNextClassification(): Delay fragment update if necessary.

Doing this after onSaveInstanceState() (but before resuming) caused a crash
during a connectivity change onReceive():
https://github.com/murraycu/android-galaxyzoo/issues/21
Hopefully this fixes that.
Turn on some more inspection checks.

Add an Application subclass, as a useful place to initialize some debug stuff.

The Application documentation suggests using a separate singelton for most stuff,
which we already do:
http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Application.html
However, this seems like the right place to do library initialization.

Use LeakCanary, though it hasn't found anything yet:
https://github.com/square/leakcanary/blob/master/README.md

ClassifyActivity: Move Picasso listener to GalaxyZooActivity.

Because otherwise it is generally called too late.
ZooniverseClientTest: Replace MockWebServer's deprecated play() with start().

Use the new (and now only active) sloan_singleband survey group.

As in the Galaxy Zoo web UI as of yesterday:
https://github.com/zooniverse/Galaxy-Zoo/commit/1e775e0b2d5bf593e429a81d622a418706140165

sloan_singleband: Temporarily disable the sloan_singleband-1 questions.

This is the 'Could this be a disk viewed edge-on?' question.
See https://github.com/zooniverse/Galaxy-Zoo/pull/198
